result.value: Open source Biomarker discovery tool based on multi-objective Evolutionary algorithm and the XGBoost Classifier

An open source biomarker discovery tool based on a multi-objective Evolutionary algorithm and the XGBoost Classifier. Benchmarked on 2 datasets. One omics and one clinical. With MEvA-X the performance of the XGBoost Classifiers improved their overall performance and/or the simplicity of the final models.

Tutorial

A tutorial of how to use the tool in the form of a notebook can be found in the directory Tutorial.

Example of calling MEvA-X from terminal:

Example of calling MEvA-X from terminal:

This script is up and running and there is a detailed tutorial on the directory Tutorial.

Parameters of the algorithm:

Parameter name Short description Default value Comment
Population Number of individuals for the evolutionary algorithm 50 The higher the value the better the space can be explored but the slower the algorithm will get. Advised values: 50-200
Generations Number of gererations the evolutionary will run for 100 The higher the value the better the further we allow the algorithm to explore, but the slower the algorithm will get overall. Advised values: 50-200
dataset_filename Name of the data in the current directory None The dataset must be in the form of FeaturesXSamples in .txt, .csv, or .tsv format
labels_filename Name of the file that contains the labels of the datapoints None The labels must be in the form of an array with no labels
two_points_crossover_probability probability of the offsprings to be produced by the exchange of pieces from the parental individuals 0.9 (90%) Controls what percentage of offspring will be the result of the crossover of its parental chromosomes. The higher the probability, the less conservative the solutions are (dependig on the similarity of the parental solutions). If it is used along with the arithmetic_crossover_probability their sum should not be greater than 1. The recommended values are [0.75-0.95]
arithmetic_crossover_probability probability of an arithmetic crossover of the parental individuals to produce the offsprings 0.0 (0%) Controls what percentage of offspring will be the result of the crossover of its parental chromosomes. The higher the probability, the less conservative the solutions are (dependig on the similarity of the parental solutions). If it is used along with the two_points_crossover_probability their sum should not be greater than 1. The recommended values are [0.0-0.1]
mutation_probability probability of an offspring to mutate 0.05 (5%) Control what percentage of offspring that will experience point mutations after their creation. The higher the probability, the more diverse the new population will be. The recommended values are [0.03-0.1]
goal_significances_filename array of weights for the objectives array of ones in the length of the objectives The weights must be in the form of an array with no labels
num_of_folds Number of folds for cross validation 10 The less the number of folds the more data the models are trained in each fold but the less certain we are for the robustness. The recommended values are [5-15]

Calling the script with custom parameters

Parameter symbol Explanation
--dataset_path or -A Data path and filename. The expected format is: FeaturesXSamples
--labels_path", -B Labels path and filename. The expected format is an unnamed list
--FS_dir The path where the precalculated Feature selections are stored for JMI,MRMR,SelectKBest,Wilcoxon rank sum. Default = None
--output_dir The pathe where to save the results. If None is given, the default is "./Results" in the current working directory
--K, -k Number of Folds for the Stratified K-fold of the Machine Learning algorithm validation. Default = 10
--P, -p The population of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 50
--G, -g The number of generations/iterations of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 100
--crossover_perc Probability of a two-point crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.9 (90%)
--arithmetic_perc Probability of an arithmetic crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.0 (0%) deactivated
--mutation_perc The probability of point mutations to occure in the genome of an offspring. Default = 0.05 (5%).
--goal_sig_path, -gsp The path to the file containing the weights of the evaluation metrics
--goal_sig_list, -gsl The array of the weights for the evaluation metrics. Default = [0.8, 0.8, 0.8, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 0.5, 2]
--impute Boolean selector for the imputation of missing values with a KNN imputer. Default = True
--normalize Boolean selector for the normalization of the data. Default = True
--verbose, -V Boolean selector for the output messages during the script execution. Default = False (quiet)
--plot, -plt Boolean selector for saving some plots of the trained models. Default = False
--cores, -c Selector of the CPU cores to use while running the algorithm. Default = 1
--mi_k, -m K parameter for the K-NN to use while calculating the Mutual Information for the feature selection. Applicable when there are no precalculatedvalues. Default = 5

# MEvA-X
An open source biomarker discovery tool based on a multi-objective Evolutionary algorithm and the XGBoost Classifier.
Benchmarked on 2 datasets. One omics and one clinical. With MEvA-X the performance of the XGBoost Classifiers improved their overall performance and/or the simplicity of the final models.

Python version >=3.9.x - <= 3.11.x https://www.python.org/

Dependencies:

Library Version Link
Pandas 1.4.4 https://pypi.org/project/pandas/
XGBoost 1.7.3 https://pypi.org/project/xgboost/
Numpy 1.21.5 https://numpy.org/
Sklearn 0.24.2 https://scikit-learn.org/stable/
mifs 0.0.1.dev0 https://github.com/danielhomola/mifs
pickle https://docs.python.org/3/library/pickle.html
knnimpute 0.1.0 https://github.com/iskandr/knnimpute
requests 2.28.1 https://pypi.org/project/requests/

Example of calling MEvA-X from terminal:

Example of calling MEvA-X from terminal:

This script is up and running and there is a detailed tutorial on the directory Tutorial.

Calling the general version of the script

# MEvA-X An open source biomarker discovery tool based on a multi-objective Evolutionary algorithm and the XGBoost Classifier. Benchmarked on 2 datasets. One omics and one clinical. With MEvA-X the performance of the XGBoost Classifiers improved their overall performance and/or the simplicity of the final models.

Flowchart

Details

About the algorithm:

Python version >=3.9.x - <= 3.11.x https://www.python.org/

Dependencies:

Library Version Link
Pandas 1.4.4 https://pypi.org/project/pandas/
XGBoost 1.7.3 https://pypi.org/project/xgboost/
Numpy 1.21.5 https://numpy.org/
Sklearn 0.24.2 https://scikit-learn.org/stable/
mifs 0.0.1.dev0 https://github.com/danielhomola/mifs
pickle https://docs.python.org/3/library/pickle.html
knnimpute 0.1.0 https://github.com/iskandr/knnimpute
requests 2.28.1 https://pypi.org/project/requests/

Tutorial

A tutorial of how to use the tool in the form of a notebook can be found in the directory Tutorial.

Example of calling MEvA-X from terminal:

Example of calling MEvA-X from terminal:

This script is up and running and there is a detailed tutorial on the directory Tutorial.

``` python MEvA-X.py --dataset_path ./Data/Ornish/diet_dataset.txt --labels_path ./Data/Ornish/diet_labels.txt --output_dir ./Data/Ornish/Results --K 5 --G 30 --P 60 --FS_dir ./Data/Ornish/FS_methods --goal_sig_path ./Data/Ornish/metrics_weights.txt --verbose False --plot False ```

The parameters of the algorithm can be changed directly through the script in the __main__ section for the version V1.0.0. See in the table below the details for the parameters the user can experiment with:

Parameters of the algorithm:

Parameter name Short description Default value Comment
Population Number of individuals for the evolutionary algorithm 50 The higher the value the better the space can be explored but the slower the algorithm will get. Advised values: 50-200
Generations Number of gererations the evolutionary will run for 100 The higher the value the better the further we allow the algorithm to explore, but the slower the algorithm will get overall. Advised values: 50-200
dataset_filename Name of the data in the current directory None The dataset must be in the form of FeaturesXSamples in .txt, .csv, or .tsv format
labels_filename Name of the file that contains the labels of the datapoints None The labels must be in the form of an array with no labels
two_points_crossover_probability probability of the offsprings to be produced by the exchange of pieces from the parental individuals 0.9 (90%) Controls what percentage of offspring will be the result of the crossover of its parental chromosomes. The higher the probability, the less conservative the solutions are (dependig on the similarity of the parental solutions). If it is used along with the arithmetic_crossover_probability their sum should not be greater than 1. The recommended values are [0.75-0.95]
arithmetic_crossover_probability probability of an arithmetic crossover of the parental individuals to produce the offsprings 0.0 (0%) Controls what percentage of offspring will be the result of the crossover of its parental chromosomes. The higher the probability, the less conservative the solutions are (dependig on the similarity of the parental solutions). If it is used along with the two_points_crossover_probability their sum should not be greater than 1. The recommended values are [0.0-0.1]
mutation_probability probability of an offspring to mutate 0.05 (5%) Control what percentage of offspring that will experience point mutations after their creation. The higher the probability, the more diverse the new population will be. The recommended values are [0.03-0.1]
goal_significances_filename array of weights for the objectives array of ones in the length of the objectives The weights must be in the form of an array with no labels
num_of_folds Number of folds for cross validation 10 The less the number of folds the more data the models are trained in each fold but the less certain we are for the robustness. The recommended values are [5-15]

Calling the general version of the script

``` python MEvA-X_V1.0.0.py ```

Calling the script for the OPERA study dataset

It has minor differences on the way it reads the data, because the OPERA labels file contains the name of each samlpe as headers.

``` python MEvA-X_V1.0.0_opera.py ```

Calling the script with custom parameters

Parameter symbol Explanation
--dataset_path or -A Data path and filename. The expected format is: FeaturesXSamples
--labels_path", -B Labels path and filename. The expected format is an unnamed list
--FS_dir The path where the precalculated Feature selections are stored for JMI,MRMR,SelectKBest,Wilcoxon rank sum. Default = None
--output_dir The pathe where to save the results. If None is given, the default is "./Results" in the current working directory
--K, -k Number of Folds for the Stratified K-fold of the Machine Learning algorithm validation. Default = 10
--P, -p The population of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 50
--G, -g The number of generations/iterations of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 100
--crossover_perc Probability of a two-point crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.9 (90%)
--arithmetic_perc Probability of an arithmetic crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.0 (0%) deactivated
--mutation_perc The probability of point mutations to occure in the genome of an offspring. Default = 0.05 (5%).
--goal_sig_path, -gsp The path to the file containing the weights of the evaluation metrics
--goal_sig_list, -gsl The array of the weights for the evaluation metrics. Default = [0.8, 0.8, 0.8, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 0.5, 2]
--impute Boolean selector for the imputation of missing values with a KNN imputer. Default = True
--normalize Boolean selector for the normalization of the data. Default = True
--verbose, -V Boolean selector for the output messages during the script execution. Default = False (quiet)
--plot, -plt Boolean selector for saving some plots of the trained models. Default = False
--cores, -c Selector of the CPU cores to use while running the algorithm. Default = 1
--mi_k, -m K parameter for the K-NN to use while calculating the Mutual Information for the feature selection. Applicable when there are no precalculatedvalues. Default = 5

result.original_header: Calling the script for the OPERA study dataset

Parameter name Short description Default value Comment

The higher the probability, the less conservative the solutions are (dependig on the similarity of the parental solutions). If it is used along with the two_points_crossover_probability their sum should not be greater than 1. The recommended values are [0.0-0.1]

num_of_folds Number of folds for cross validation 10 The less the number of folds the more data the models are trained in each fold but the less certain we are for the robustness. The recommended values are [5-15]

Calling the general version of the script

``` python MEvA-X_V1.0.0.py ```

Calling the script for the OPERA study dataset

It has minor differences on the way it reads the data, because the OPERA labels file contains the name of each samlpe as headers.

``` python MEvA-X_V1.0.0_opera.py ```

Calling the script with custom parameters

Parameter symbol Explanation
--dataset_path or -A Data path and filename. The expected format is: FeaturesXSamples
--labels_path", -B Labels path and filename. The expected format is an unnamed list
--FS_dir The path where the precalculated Feature selections are stored for JMI,MRMR,SelectKBest,Wilcoxon rank sum. Default = None
--output_dir The pathe where to save the results. If None is given, the default is "./Results" in the current working directory
--K, -k Number of Folds for the Stratified K-fold of the Machine Learning algorithm validation. Default = 10
--P, -p The population of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 50
--G, -g The number of generations/iterations of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 100
--crossover_perc Probability of a two-point crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.9 (90%)
--arithmetic_perc Probability of an arithmetic crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.0 (0%) deactivated

``` python MEvA-X.py --dataset_path ./Data/Ornish/diet_dataset.txt --labels_path ./Data/Ornish/diet_labels.txt --output_dir ./Data/Ornish/Results --K 5 --G 30 --P 60 --FS_dir ./Data/Ornish/FS_methods --goal_sig_path ./Data/Ornish/metrics_weights.txt --verbose False --plot False ```

The parameters of the algorithm can be changed directly through the script in the __main__ section for the version V1.0.0. See in the table below the details for the parameters the user can experiment with:

Parameters of the algorithm:

Parameter name Short description Default value Comment
Population Number of individuals for the evolutionary algorithm 50 The higher the value the better the space can be explored but the slower the algorithm will get. Advised values: 50-200
Generations Number of gererations the evolutionary will run for 100 The higher the value the better the further we allow the algorithm to explore, but the slower the algorithm will get overall. Advised values: 50-200
dataset_filename Name of the data in the current directory None The dataset must be in the form of FeaturesXSamples in .txt, .csv, or .tsv format
labels_filename Name of the file that contains the labels of the datapoints None The labels must be in the form of an array with no labels
two_points_crossover_probability probability of the offsprings to be produced by the exchange of pieces from the parental individuals 0.9 (90%) Controls what percentage of offspring will be the result of the crossover of its parental chromosomes. The higher the probability, the less conservative the solutions are (dependig on the similarity of the parental solutions). If it is used along with the arithmetic_crossover_probability their sum should not be greater than 1. The recommended values are [0.75-0.95]
arithmetic_crossover_probability probability of an arithmetic crossover of the parental individuals to produce the offsprings 0.0 (0%) Controls what percentage of offspring will be the result of the crossover of its parental chromosomes. The higher the probability, the less conservative the solutions are (dependig on the similarity of the parental solutions). If it is used along with the two_points_crossover_probability their sum should not be greater than 1. The recommended values are [0.0-0.1]
mutation_probability probability of an offspring to mutate 0.05 (5%) Control what percentage of offspring that will experience point mutations after their creation. The higher the probability, the more diverse the new population will be. The recommended values are [0.03-0.1]
goal_significances_filename array of weights for the objectives array of ones in the length of the objectives The weights must be in the form of an array with no labels
num_of_folds Number of folds for cross validation 10 The less the number of folds the more data the models are trained in each fold but the less certain we are for the robustness. The recommended values are [5-15]

Calling the general version of the script

``` python MEvA-X_V1.0.0.py ```

Calling the script for the OPERA study dataset

It has minor differences on the way it reads the data, because the OPERA labels file contains the name of each samlpe as headers.

``` python MEvA-X_V1.0.0_opera.py ```

Calling the script with custom parameters

Parameter symbol Explanation
--dataset_path or -A Data path and filename. The expected format is: FeaturesXSamples
--labels_path", -B Labels path and filename. The expected format is an unnamed list
--FS_dir The path where the precalculated Feature selections are stored for JMI,MRMR,SelectKBest,Wilcoxon rank sum. Default = None
--output_dir The pathe where to save the results. If None is given, the default is "./Results" in the current working directory
--K, -k Number of Folds for the Stratified K-fold of the Machine Learning algorithm validation. Default = 10
--P, -p The population of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 50
--G, -g The number of generations/iterations of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 100
--crossover_perc Probability of a two-point crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.9 (90%)
--arithmetic_perc Probability of an arithmetic crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.0 (0%) deactivated
--mutation_perc The probability of point mutations to occure in the genome of an offspring. Default = 0.05 (5%).
--goal_sig_path, -gsp The path to the file containing the weights of the evaluation metrics
--goal_sig_list, -gsl The array of the weights for the evaluation metrics. Default = [0.8, 0.8, 0.8, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 0.5, 2]
--impute Boolean selector for the imputation of missing values with a KNN imputer. Default = True
--normalize Boolean selector for the normalization of the data. Default = True
--verbose, -V Boolean selector for the output messages during the script execution. Default = False (quiet)
--plot, -plt Boolean selector for saving some plots of the trained models. Default = False
--cores, -c Selector of the CPU cores to use while running the algorithm. Default = 1
--mi_k, -m K parameter for the K-NN to use while calculating the Mutual Information for the feature selection. Applicable when there are no precalculatedvalues. Default = 5

parent_header: Example of calling MEvA-X from terminal:
result.value:
# MEvA-X An open source biomarker discovery tool based on a multi-objective Evolutionary algorithm and the XGBoost Classifier. Benchmarked on 2 datasets. One omics and one clinical. With MEvA-X the performance of the XGBoost Classifiers improved their overall performance and/or the simplicity of the final models.

Flowchart

Details

About the algorithm:

Python version >=3.9.x - <= 3.11.x https://www.python.org/

Dependencies:

Library Version Link
Pandas 1.4.4 https://pypi.org/project/pandas/
XGBoost 1.7.3 https://pypi.org/project/xgboost/
Numpy 1.21.5 https://numpy.org/
Sklearn 0.24.2 https://scikit-learn.org/stable/
mifs 0.0.1.dev0 https://github.com/danielhomola/mifs
pickle https://docs.python.org/3/library/pickle.html
knnimpute 0.1.0 https://github.com/iskandr/knnimpute
requests 2.28.1 https://pypi.org/project/requests/

Tutorial

A tutorial of how to use the tool in the form of a notebook can be found in the directory Tutorial.

Example of calling MEvA-X from terminal:

Example of calling MEvA-X from terminal:

This script is up and running and there is a detailed tutorial on the directory Tutorial.

``` python MEvA-X.py --dataset_path ./Data/Ornish/diet_dataset.txt --labels_path ./Data/Ornish/diet_labels.txt --output_dir ./Data/Ornish/Results --K 5 --G 30 --P 60 --FS_dir ./Data/Ornish/FS_methods --goal_sig_path ./Data/Ornish/metrics_weights.txt --verbose False --plot False ```

The parameters of the algorithm can be changed directly through the script in the __main__ section for the version V1.0.0. See in the table below the details for the parameters the user can experiment with:

Parameters of the algorithm:

Parameter name Short description Default value Comment
Population Number of individuals for the evolutionary algorithm 50 The higher the value the better the space can be explored but the slower the algorithm will get. Advised values: 50-200
Generations Number of gererations the evolutionary will run for 100 The higher the value the better the further we allow the algorithm to explore, but the slower the algorithm will get overall. Advised values: 50-200
dataset_filename Name of the data in the current directory None The dataset must be in the form of FeaturesXSamples in .txt, .csv, or .tsv format
labels_filename Name of the file that contains the labels of the datapoints None The labels must be in the form of an array with no labels
two_points_crossover_probability probability of the offsprings to be produced by the exchange of pieces from the parental individuals 0.9 (90%) Controls what percentage of offspring will be the result of the crossover of its parental chromosomes. The higher the probability, the less conservative the solutions are (dependig on the similarity of the parental solutions). If it is used along with the arithmetic_crossover_probability their sum should not be greater than 1. The recommended values are [0.75-0.95]
arithmetic_crossover_probability probability of an arithmetic crossover of the parental individuals to produce the offsprings 0.0 (0%) Controls what percentage of offspring will be the result of the crossover of its parental chromosomes. The higher the probability, the less conservative the solutions are (dependig on the similarity of the parental solutions). If it is used along with the two_points_crossover_probability their sum should not be greater than 1. The recommended values are [0.0-0.1]
mutation_probability probability of an offspring to mutate 0.05 (5%) Control what percentage of offspring that will experience point mutations after their creation. The higher the probability, the more diverse the new population will be. The recommended values are [0.03-0.1]
goal_significances_filename array of weights for the objectives array of ones in the length of the objectives The weights must be in the form of an array with no labels
num_of_folds Number of folds for cross validation 10 The less the number of folds the more data the models are trained in each fold but the less certain we are for the robustness. The recommended values are [5-15]

Calling the general version of the script

``` python MEvA-X_V1.0.0.py ```

Calling the script for the OPERA study dataset

It has minor differences on the way it reads the data, because the OPERA labels file contains the name of each samlpe as headers.

``` python MEvA-X_V1.0.0_opera.py ```

Calling the script with custom parameters

Parameter symbol Explanation
--dataset_path or -A Data path and filename. The expected format is: FeaturesXSamples
--labels_path", -B Labels path and filename. The expected format is an unnamed list
--FS_dir The path where the precalculated Feature selections are stored for JMI,MRMR,SelectKBest,Wilcoxon rank sum. Default = None
--output_dir The pathe where to save the results. If None is given, the default is "./Results" in the current working directory
--K, -k Number of Folds for the Stratified K-fold of the Machine Learning algorithm validation. Default = 10
--P, -p The population of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 50
--G, -g The number of generations/iterations of the Genetic algorithm. Default = 100
--crossover_perc Probability of a two-point crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.9 (90%)
--arithmetic_perc Probability of an arithmetic crossover for the creation of a new offsping. Default = 0.0 (0%) deactivated
--mutation_perc The probability of point mutations to occure in the genome of an offspring. Default = 0.05 (5%).
--goal_sig_path, -gsp The path to the file containing the weights of the evaluation metrics
--goal_sig_list, -gsl The array of the weights for the evaluation metrics. Default = [0.8, 0.8, 0.8, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 0.5, 2]
--impute Boolean selector for the imputation of missing values with a KNN imputer. Default = True
--normalize Boolean selector for the normalization of the data. Default = True
--verbose, -V Boolean selector for the output messages during the script execution. Default = False (quiet)
--plot, -plt Boolean selector for saving some plots of the trained models. Default = False
--cores, -c Selector of the CPU cores to use while running the algorithm. Default = 1
--mi_k, -m K parameter for the K-NN to use while calculating the Mutual Information for the feature selection. Applicable when there are no precalculatedvalues. Default = 5
